instruction: How was the machine learning algorithm formulated and implemented in the study to predict mental stress levels of aged people at rest using NIRS data from the prefrontal cortex?
Output:
The machine learning algorithm used in the study to predict mental stress levels of aged people at rest was formulated within a Bayesian machine learning framework and implemented using Markov Chain Monte Carlo. The algorithm was trained using two-channel near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) data from the prefrontal cortex (PFC) of 19 subjects aged 20-24 years. The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) was used as the mental stress index. 

In the study, the algorithm was applied to predict mental stress levels in aged subjects aged 61-79 years (10 women; 7 men). After the subjects answered the STAI questionnaire, the NIRS device measured changes in oxy- and deoxy-hemoglobin concentration during a 3-minute resting state. 

Leave-one-subject-out cross-validation was performed to evaluate the performance of the algorithm. The average prediction error between the actual and predicted STAI values was 5.27. Additionally, the prediction errors of 12 subjects were lower than 5.0, indicating that the algorithm was effective in predicting mental stress levels in aged subjects.
